oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Ambrotype of Private Samuel W. Hannon
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Ambrotype of Pvt. Samuel W. Hannon, Co. G., 60th N.C. Inf. Regt., CSA. He enlisted in Polk County, North Carolina on August 29, 1862 at the age of 32 and died on December 28, 1862 in a hospital at Ringgold, Georgia. Hannon is holding what is likely a; Bible and wearing a large but unmarked belt buckle. The 60th N.C. Inf. Regt., CSA was recruited in Western N.C. and did include some Tenn. soldiers. The regiment was one of the only N.C. regiments in the Army of Tennessee.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Hannon, Samuel W.
